commit_message:
Update libvirt cpu map before starting nova

We are trying to get a working 64bit qemu cpu model in the gate for nova
live migration testing. It appears that we need to make this change
prior to nova starting.

Make the change in configure_libvirt() to handle this along with the
other libvirt config updates. This allows us to restart the libvirt
service once. This function calls a python tool which parses and updates
the XML if necessary.

Change-Id: I00667713bfba67ab8cedbcb1660ff94d4f4bcc07

subject: Raise an error on python 2.6.x with non-one step
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-22 07:52:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Raise an error on python 2.6.x with non-one step

Since a msgpack serialized value may be created on
python2.7+ which supports a itertools step we should
make sure that we raise a value error when we encounter
this non-one step on python2.6 so that we do wrongly
create a valid count under that python version.

Change-Id: Ibc0bf0fe92749c1972cdc9904537b6ea614ceb64
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-22 07:55:58.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_serialization/msgpackutils.py'], 'message': 'Raise an error on python 2.6.x with non-one step

Since a msgpack serialized value may be created on
python2.7+ which supports a itertools step we should
make sure that we raise a value error when we encounter
this non-one step on python2.6 so that we do not wrongly
create a invalid count under that python version.

Change-Id: Ibc0bf0fe92749c1972cdc9904537b6ea614ceb64
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Raise an error on python 2.6.x with non-one step

Since a msgpack serialized value may be created on
python2.7+ which supports a itertools step we should
make sure that we raise a value error when we encounter
this non-one step on python2.6 so that we do not wrongly
create a invalid count under that python version.

Change-Id: Ibc0bf0fe92749c1972cdc9904537b6ea614ceb64

resulted in truncated string. This patch workarounds the problem by
dropping the XML flags.

commit_message:
Import fernet providers only if used in keystone-manage

The fernet provider is optional and has extra requirements beyond
other token providers. keystone-manage shouldn't require these
extra requirements just to run.

Closes-Bug: 1440123
Change-Id: I2363e090372bdb709a6754a216db45fc649a5aed

commit_message:
Set stack status to FAILED when engine is down

When stack is in status IN_PROGRESS and engine service went down,
the status of stack will forever remain in IN_PROGRESS. This patch
add a db apid to get engine_id from stacklock and try to reset the
stack status to FAILED when engine is back.

Closes-Bug: #1382320
Change-Id: Ica856bb0d56c23a4423fb9476c1986aaacf24108

commit_message:
Remove the schema_diff script

The schema_diff script was used to compare schemas before and after
compacting migrations to make sure we didn't miss something when doing
the compaction.

With commit dd62c680f52b81bdcfa1d9215b9ceb99679fb5c1 and the
test_models_sync unit test in oslo.db, we basically get the same thing
but with an automated unit test run on every change (and
test_models_sync runs on all backends that oslo.db supports, so it
already tests mysql, postgresql and sqlite today).

So there doesn't seem to be a need to have schema_diff.py anymore.

Change-Id: Icdbfd256d1300a5f52052309f57bc6df5a4d876c

commit_message:
cDOT multi-SVM driver may choose unsuitable physical port for LIFs

The algorithm used by the NetApp cDOT multi-SVM driver for choosing
a physical port on which to create logical interfaces (LIFs) is too
simplistic, which can result in the selection of ports that won't
work at all or which are far inferior to other choices.  This patch
improves the port selection query, sorts ports by speed, and allows
the user to override the port selection via a regex setting in the
manila.conf file.

Closes-Bug: #1434918
Change-Id: Idedcb0db23df3a745f0c1ced2652da008746f0a6

subject: Restore automatic unicode conversion
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-10 14:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/log.py'], 'message': "Restore automatic unicode conversion

Earlier versions of oslo.log tried to assume that getLogger() was not
generally being used and so we relied on the developer to ensure that
their log messages were valid unicode strings. Since then we have found
a lot of cases where non-unicode (indeed, non-string) objects are passed
to loggers as messages. To avoid the resulting unicode-related errors,
this patch restores the old behavior of having the adapter convert
messages to unicode before passing them down the stack to the
logger. The caveat that comes with relying on this is that it only works
for OpenStack code that calls oslo_log.log.getLogger, and not the
standard libary's logging.getLogger.

Change-Id: Ia74f4ea043c293106bf962fb4d5bd52065e42213
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Restore automatic unicode conversion

Earlier versions of oslo.log tried to assume that getLogger() was not
generally being used and so we relied on the developer to ensure that
their log messages were valid unicode strings. Since then we have found
a lot of cases where non-unicode (indeed, non-string) objects are passed
to loggers as messages. To avoid the resulting unicode-related errors,
this patch restores the old behavior of having the adapter convert
messages to unicode before passing them down the stack to the
logger. The caveat that comes with relying on this is that it only works
for OpenStack code that calls oslo_log.log.getLogger, and not the
standard libary's logging.getLogger.

Change-Id: Ia74f4ea043c293106bf962fb4d5bd52065e42213

commit_message:
Set share-type on share created from snapshot

This commit ensures that when one creates a share from a snapshot
the new share has the same share-type as the share on which the
snapshot is based.

Closes-bug: 1420369

Change-Id: Icad04edd3eab6d40e56352a9a7d298b6efd80e93

commit_message:
Leverage dict comprehension in PEP-0274

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions to replace dict constructor
with a sequence of key-pairs[1], these are twobenefits:
  First, it makes the code look neater.
  Second, it gains a micro-optimization.

sahara dropped python 2.6 support in Kilo, we can leverage this now.

Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwargs.
This commit also adds a hacking rule.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/

Closes-Bug: #1430786
Change-Id: I507f2c520ddab1ae3d8487bf7aea497306eb6eb2

commit_message:
Deprecate the nova_manage client

The nova_manage command is out of scope for the cli tests so let's
deprecate it's usage, it will be removed in a future release. The
only usage in tempest is removed in change
I2a4da6a0d858f89fd0c91aac6e94075bc21e19be so nothing should
be depending on this when we decide to remove it.

Change-Id: I222cf59e77f2d0cf08688c26151492647f29344d

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-03-26 22:30:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Tolerate project_id+deleted index at db update

Changing the migration scripts to allow an already existing
 project_id+deleted index.

Related-Bug: #1378395

Change-Id: Ie2492f98374544003bfc9b3b7f8c4a4a7a54ba8d
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-04-03 14:46:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/274_update_instances_project_id_index.py'], 'message': "Make migration 274 idempotent so it can be backported

Migration 274 introduced a new index on project_id+deleted which
speeds up a lot of operations that have quota checks, like server 
delete, by a couple of orders of magnitude in environments that 
regularly create/destroy servers. This was such a dramatic fix 
that it's desired in older versions of OpenStack. (See bug: #1378395)

Before the migration can be backported, this index add needs to be
made idempotent, so that if people have this index in an older 
version of OpenStack they don't explode horribly when upgrading to 
Kilo. (Realistically all index add migrations should be added in 
idempotent forms in the first place, but we seem to have not being 
doing that recently.)

Related-Bug: #1378395

Change-Id: Ie2492f98374544003bfc9b3b7f8c4a4a7a54ba8d", 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Make migration 274 idempotent so it can be backported

Migration 274 introduced a new index on project_id+deleted which
speeds up a lot of operations that have quota checks, like server 
delete, by a couple of orders of magnitude in environments that 
regularly create/destroy servers. This was such a dramatic fix 
that it's desired in older versions of OpenStack. (See bug: #1378395)

Before the migration can be backported, this index add needs to be
made idempotent, so that if people have this index in an older 
version of OpenStack they don't explode horribly when upgrading to 
Kilo. (Realistically all index add migrations should be added in 
idempotent forms in the first place, but we seem to have not being 
doing that recently.)

Related-Bug: #1378395

Change-Id: Ie2492f98374544003bfc9b3b7f8c4a4a7a54ba8d

commit_message:
Cisco N1kv:Allow n/w delete if subnets are around

Permit networks with underlying subnets to be deleted in Cisco N1kv
plugin, by cleaning up those subnets. Similarly, cleanup all the
DHCP ports for the subnets before removing them.

Change-Id: I549415ffd9618ab7c106696f9c6aaa9401c8f390
Closes-Bug: 1379583

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-26 02:22:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes race condition in N1KV segment-id alloc

In a HA setup when concurrent requests are recieved for
segment-id allocation, a race condition may arise due to which
same segment-id can be allocated for both segments. Using
lockmode update to lock out other requests from using id.

Change-Id: Iad420d3b4f13de623bb30383c2e62a54636ec3f5
Closes-Bug: 1396387

commit_message:
Fixes race condition in N1KV segment-id alloc

In a HA setup when concurrent requests are received for
segment-id allocation, a race condition may arise due to which
same segment-id can be allocated for both segments. Using
lockmode update to lock out other requests from using id.

Change-Id: Iad420d3b4f13de623bb30383c2e62a54636ec3f5
Closes-Bug: 1396387

commit_message:
Fix missing reference

Fix a warning that security-boundaries-and-threats-attack-types could
not be found. We need to use a figure to reference an object.

Fix reference as well to use xref.

Change-Id: Idf25ce9960082224bc73e36b7388ee50908f01fc

commit_message:
Include all strings for translations.

Building should not handle our tags, thus set *all* tags at once so that
all files get included in the po files.

Change-Id: I061988451543caea926cc60a3517203fc1807298

subject: Proxy delete method
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-13 19:13:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Proxy delete method

This change introduces a common delete API that can be applied to every
proxy method that revolves around deleting a resource. In particular,
the change applies that base method to deleting a server.

The method takes either a resource or an ID and calls delete on it,
after obtaining the canonical resource for that value out of
Resource.from_id.

Since this temporarily involves two separate proxy delete APIs, I've
called the test verify_delete2. When we apply it everywhere in a mass
change, we will go back to one test.

Change-Id: I755c57e9bd9cec597a5bcf84c527e7bd6d710fb3

This change introduces a common delete API that can be applied to every
proxy method that revolves around deleting a resource. In particular,
the change applies that base method to deleting a server.

The method takes either a resource or an ID and calls delete on the
corresponding resource, after obtaining the canonical ID for that value
out of Resource.get_id. Additionally, a decorator has been added that
checks if resources that are passed to it are of the appropriate type
for that operation. For example, this will raise ValueError if you try
to call delete_server with a flavor, rather than making the call to the
flavor's ID and having a potentially misleading 404 Not Found error.

Since this temporarily involves two separate proxy delete APIs, I've
called the test verify_delete2. When we apply it everywhere in a mass
change, we will go back to one test.

Change-Id: I755c57e9bd9cec597a5bcf84c527e7bd6d710fb3
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-03-18 04:07:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Proxy delete method

This change introduces a common delete API that can be applied to every
proxy method that revolves around deleting a resource. In particular,
the change applies that base method to deleting a server.

The method takes either a resource or an ID and calls delete on the
corresponding resource, after obtaining the canonical ID for that value
out of Resource.get_id. Additionally, a decorator has been added that
checks if resources that are passed to it are of the appropriate type
for that operation. For example, this will raise ValueError if you try
to call delete_server with a flavor, rather than making the call to the
flavor's ID and having a potentially misleading 404 Not Found error.

Two things to note: Since this temporarily involves two separate proxy
delete APIs, I've called the test verify_delete2. That calls a second
implementation of the verify function as _verify2 -- I would strongly
prefer to leave that as-is for now instead of adding in temporary logic
to complicate that method (all it does is remove the self.session from
assert_called_with).  When we apply this API everywhere in a mass
change, we will go back to one test. When all of the APIs have been
changed, we will go back to one verify.

Change-Id: I755c57e9bd9cec597a5bcf84c527e7bd6d710fb3

assert_called_with).  When we apply this API everywhere in a mass
change, we will go back to one test. When all of the APIs have been
changed, we will go back to one verify.

commit_message:
Proxy delete method

This change introduces a common delete API that can be applied to every
proxy method that revolves around deleting a resource. In particular,
the change applies that base method to deleting a server.

The method takes either a resource or an ID and calls delete on the
corresponding resource, after obtaining the canonical ID for that value
out of Resource.get_id. This value is checked before making the request
to see if we can determine it's of the wrong resource type by the
_check_resource decorator.

Additionally, in the case of a 404, by default this is ignored, but if
ignore_missing is set to False, we handle a 404 and raise
exceptions.ResourceNotFound as a more descriptive exception.

Change-Id: I755c57e9bd9cec597a5bcf84c527e7bd6d710fb3

commit_message:
Remove link about implementing job garbage binning

This link is no longer relevant as we now have a
jobboard method that can trash() jobs so that they
can not be claimed again.

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent rule insert bug

Previously, if you inserted 2 facts into the policy engine with
different numbers of columns, you would get an error that would
leave the system in an inconsistent state where the 2nd fact
is in the policy engine, but is not indexed, and is not in
the database.

This fix catches exceptions thrown during indexing and reverts
the change to the policy-engine before re-raising the exception.
This fix also includes a test for this flaw.

Related-bug: 1438398
Change-Id: Id2abf06da68cf87cee7a8754564e143fe10db807

subject: Add native support for Datalog column references
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-28 00:55:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add native support for Datalog column references

Previously we supported column references within the Datalog
policy language by transforming them at compile-time into
traditional Datalog rules.  This is problematic because
it requires the schema be known at the time the rules are
inserted into the system, and now that datasources can be
created/deleted at runtime we no longer know the schemas
when the rules are inserted.

This builds column-references into the compiler, the
analysis algorithms, and the evaluation procedures so
that everything works natively with both traditional
positional arguments and column-reference arguments.

commit_message:
Add native support for Datalog column references

Previously we supported column references within the Datalog
policy language by transforming them at compile-time into
traditional Datalog rules.  This is problematic because
it requires the schema be known at the time the rules are
inserted into the system, and now that datasources can be
created/deleted at runtime we no longer know the schemas
when the rules are inserted.

This builds column-references into the compiler, the
analysis algorithms, and the evaluation procedures so
that everything works natively with both traditional
positional arguments and column-reference arguments.

Change-Id: I28c1d9efd9086a2e559cab50e4b4cc63428cbdda

subject: Add _check_resource to BaseProxy
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-24 15:23:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add _check_resource to BaseProxy

All of the base methods on BaseProxy need to check their arguments in
order to prevent requests from being made on the wrong types, preventing
potentially confusing error messages. This was originally part of the
delete change but is better by itself.

Change-Id: I75d398fda55e80db5877bb7d55f7ff3d5dbd88ad
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-26 19:15:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add _check_resource to BaseProxy

All of the base methods on BaseProxy need to check their arguments in
order to prevent requests from being made on the wrong types, preventing
potentially confusing error messages.

This decorator covers two angles:

1. When strict=False, the `actual` parameter is checked to see if it's
   the `expected` type IFF `actual` is an instance of Resource. When
   the type does not match, ValueError is raised. If the type is
   something else, such as an id, it is passed on to the underlying
   method when it is able to additionally operate on an id, such as on a
   get or delete call.
2. When strict=True, the `actual` parameter *must* be an instance of
   Resource, otherwise it raises ValueError. This is necessary for
   methods such as create which can't operate solely on an id but
   require additional information.

As the majority of operations can be carried out with just an ID, False
is the default strict mode.

Change-Id: I75d398fda55e80db5877bb7d55f7ff3d5dbd88ad
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-03-26 21:21:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add _check_resource to BaseProxy

All of the base methods on BaseProxy need to check their arguments in
order to prevent requests from being made on the wrong types, preventing
potentially confusing error messages.

This decorator covers two cases:

1. When strict=False, the `actual` parameter is checked to see if it's
   the `expected` type IFF `actual` is an instance of Resource. When
   the type does not match, ValueError is raised. If the type is
   something else, such as an id, it is passed on to the underlying
   method when it is able to additionally operate on an id, such as on a
   get or delete call.
2. When strict=True, the `actual` parameter *must* be an instance of
   Resource, otherwise it raises ValueError. This is necessary for
   methods such as create which can't operate solely on an id but
   require additional information.

As the majority of operations can be carried out with just an ID, False
is the default strict mode.

Change-Id: I75d398fda55e80db5877bb7d55f7ff3d5dbd88ad
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-03-27 15:19:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add _check_resource to BaseProxy

All of the base methods on BaseProxy need to check their arguments in
order to prevent requests from being made on the wrong types, preventing
potentially confusing error messages.

This decorator covers two cases:

1. When strict=False, the `actual` parameter is checked to see if it's
   the `expected` type IFF `actual` is an instance of Resource. When
   the type does not match, ValueError is raised. If the type is
   something else, such as an id, it is passed on to the underlying
   method when it is able to additionally operate on an id, such as on a
   get or delete call.
2. When strict=True, the `actual` parameter must be an instance of
   Resource or None, otherwise it raises ValueError. This is necessary for
   methods such as create which can't operate solely on an id but
   require additional information.

In shorter terms: 1) if it's a resource we check it, 2) it has to be
a resource or nothing.

As the majority of operations can be carried out with just an ID, False
is the default strict mode.

Change-Id: I75d398fda55e80db5877bb7d55f7ff3d5dbd88ad

order to prevent requests from being made on the wrong types, preventing
potentially confusing error messages.

This decorator covers two cases:

1. When strict=False, the `actual` parameter is checked to see if it's
   the `expected` type IFF `actual` is an instance of Resource. When
   the type does not match, ValueError is raised. If the type is
   something else, such as an id, it is passed on to the underlying
   method when it is able to additionally operate on an id, such as on a
   get or delete call.
2. When strict=True, the `actual` parameter must be an instance of
   Resource or None, otherwise it raises ValueError. This is necessary for
   methods such as create which can't operate solely on an id but
   require additional information.

In shorter terms: 1) if it's a resource we check it, 2) it has to be
a resource or nothing.

As the majority of operations can be carried out with just an ID, False
is the default strict mode.

commit_message:
Add _check_resource to BaseProxy

All of the base methods on BaseProxy need to check their arguments in
order to prevent requests from being made on the wrong types, preventing
potentially confusing error messages.

This decorator covers two cases:

1. When strict=False, the `actual` parameter is checked to see if it's
   the `expected` type IFF `actual` is an instance of Resource. When
   the type does not match, ValueError is raised. If the type is
   something else, such as an id, it is passed on to the underlying
   method when it is able to additionally operate on an id, such as on a
   get or delete call.
2. When strict=True, the `actual` parameter must be an instance of
   Resource or None, otherwise it raises ValueError. This is necessary for
   methods such as create which can't operate solely on an id but
   require additional information.

In shorter terms: 1) if it's a resource we check it, 2) it has to be
a resource or nothing.

As the majority of operations can be carried out with just an ID, False
is the default strict mode.

Change-Id: I75d398fda55e80db5877bb7d55f7ff3d5dbd88ad

commit_message:
Simplify environment.d scripts

Just leave the exports there, removing the shebang as they are sourced
and not executed directly.

This has also the side-effect of making dib-lint ignore them, and thus
enforce on them checks which don't make any good in them.

Change-Id: I2a9506634a9b636ca97bd4a1fab72307c95b5388
Partial-Bug: #1435306

commit_message:
Improve error handling when JSON is not returned by agent

Sometimes the agent is not returning valid JSON in the response.  Handle
it better and record information about the request and the response to
help with debugging.

Will now raise an exception similar to this:
ironic.common.exception.IronicException: Unable to decode response as JSON.
Request URL: http://127.0.0.1:9999/v1/commands
Request body: "{"name": "standby.run_image",
                "params": {"image_info": {"image_id": "test_image"}}}"
Response: "this is not json"

Change-Id: I483884ca5727fbaa3120e2f7c2b381a7d7e8be17
Closes-Bug: 1439498

[{'created': '2015-03-03 03:28:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'IPv6 SLAAC subnet create should update ports on net

If ports are first created on a network, and then an IPv6 SLAAC
or DHCPv6-stateless subnet is created on that network, then the
ports created prior to the subnet create are not getting
automatically updated (associated) with addresses for the
SLAAC/DHCPv6-stateless subnet, as required.

(Note that this problem was discussed in the Neutron
multiple-ipv6-prefixes blueprint, but is being addressed
with a separate Neutron bug since this is a bug that can
potentially be backported to Juno.)

Change-Id: I5901db6655c045c0e78c7cb7fc51ce8c9a9e1933
Closes-Bug: 1427474

commit_message:
IPv6 SLAAC subnet create should update ports on net

If ports are first created on a network, and then an IPv6 SLAAC
or DHCPv6-stateless subnet is created on that network, then the
ports created prior to the subnet create are not getting
automatically updated (associated) with addresses for the
SLAAC/DHCPv6-stateless subnet, as required.

Change-Id: I5901db6655c045c0e78c7cb7fc51ce8c9a9e1933
Closes-Bug: 1427474

the current sleep(1)

subject: Add inc/rootwrap
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 04:25:03.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder', 'functions', 'lib/nova', 'inc/rootwrap'], 'message': "Add inc/rootwrap

Rootwrap shouldn't be a unique snowflake.  Plus the binaries tend
to be called assuming PATH will find them.  Not so with venvs
so we need to work around that brokenness.

Configure Cinder and Nova to use configure_rootwrap().

Change-Id: I8ee1f66014875caf20a2d14ff6ef3672673ba85a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add inc/rootwrap

Rootwrap shouldn't be a unique snowflake.  Plus the binaries tend
to be called assuming PATH will find them.  Not so with venvs
so we need to work around that brokenness.

Configure Cinder and Nova to use configure_rootwrap().

Change-Id: I8ee1f66014875caf20a2d14ff6ef3672673ba85a

subject: Add a target for, and link to, minimal config docs
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 06:41:27.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/configuration.rst'], 'message': "Add a target for, and link to, minimal config docs

Reading through the docs for the first time, the reader encounters an
instruction to provide a minimal configuration, with a link that they'd
expect to tell them how to do this.

At present the link actually takes them to the top of
configuration.html, where they read some history about how devstack's
configuration has changed over time.

This is interesting and important and should be in the docs - but in my
opinion a link about setting up a minimal configuration would be more
useful if it takes me to a place that tells them about a minimal
configuration.

To get this, I've had to an an explicit link target into
configuration.rst. I'm not hugely keen on this approach, as I don't
think it scales well. I'd be open to suggestions about other
approaches. The only idea I've had so far though is to simply move the
minimal configuration section right to the top of the page, so that a
link to the doc is a link to the minimal config - the historical
information could be moved to its own topic somewhere further down the doc.

Change-Id: I231ca1b7f17b55f09a4e058dab8ee433893f737e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add a target for, and link to, minimal config docs

Reading through the docs for the first time, the reader encounters an
instruction to provide a minimal configuration, with a link that they'd
expect to tell them how to do this.

At present the link actually takes them to the top of
configuration.html, where they read some history about how devstack's
configuration has changed over time.

This is interesting and important and should be in the docs - but in my
opinion a link about setting up a minimal configuration would be more
useful if it takes me to a place that tells them about a minimal
configuration.

To get this, I've had to an an explicit link target into
configuration.rst. I'm not hugely keen on this approach, as I don't
think it scales well. I'd be open to suggestions about other
approaches. The only idea I've had so far though is to simply move the
minimal configuration section right to the top of the page, so that a
link to the doc is a link to the minimal config - the historical
information could be moved to its own topic somewhere further down the doc.

Change-Id: I231ca1b7f17b55f09a4e058dab8ee433893f737e

subject: If cells enabled create a fixed network in the API cell
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 21:59:14.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'If cells enabled create a fixed network in the API cell

Now that tempest is querying for a network before making server create
calls the fixed network needs to be known by the API cell.  Server
creates should work for networks defined in both databases, but defining
a new network via the API will continue to not work.

Change-Id: I32461add0d20940a55385c8b34cd493e2561615e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
If cells enabled create a fixed network in the API cell

Now that tempest is querying for a network before making server create
calls the fixed network needs to be known by the API cell.  Server
creates should work for networks defined in both databases, but defining
a new network via the API will continue to not work.

Change-Id: I32461add0d20940a55385c8b34cd493e2561615e

commit_message:
Fixes ovs-vsctl add port issue

Setup of OVS may fail, if ports that are added,
are already exist. Add "--may-exist" directive to OVS
add-port command to prevent this behaviour.

Change-Id: I2280be9a63a4a6fbc747b5e32b602697b555ffa8
Closes-Bug: #1394162

subject: Set qcow image file location with right cirros version
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 15:11:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Also set qcow image file location with right cirros version

This commit ensures we also set the qcow image location in the
tempest config when we update qcow version. The tempest config has
a default value for img_file (which is incorrect) but before we can
remove the defaults in tempest we need to ensure devstack is using
it properly first. The only reason the tests weren't failing here is
because tempest falls back to using uec images (which devstack was
correctly setting config for) if qcow isn't found.

Change-Id: I05af346b3c9be9560dc8846dd1f437cfbb2d5005
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-02 16:30:08.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Set qcow image file location with right cirros version

This commit ensures we also set the qcow image location in the
tempest config when we update qcow version. The tempest config has
a default value for img_file (which is incorrect) but before we can
remove the defaults in tempest we need to ensure devstack is using
it properly first. The only reason the tests weren't failing here is
because tempest falls back to using uec images (which devstack was
correctly setting config for) if qcow isn't found. The img_dir was
also hardcoded assuming a uec image, however if qcow is intended to be
used you'll need to be able to override that, which is added as
part of this commit.

Change-Id: I05af346b3c9be9560dc8846dd1f437cfbb2d5005
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Set qcow image file location with right cirros version

This commit ensures we also set the qcow image location in the
tempest config when we update qcow version. The tempest config has
a default value for img_file (which is incorrect) but before we can
remove the defaults in tempest we need to ensure devstack is using
it properly first. The only reason the tests weren't failing here is
because tempest falls back to using uec images (which devstack was
correctly setting config for) if qcow isn't found. The img_dir was
also hardcoded assuming a uec image, however if qcow is intended to be
used you'll need to be able to override that, which is added as
part of this commit.

Change-Id: I05af346b3c9be9560dc8846dd1f437cfbb2d5005

revisions:

commit_message:
Rename the README.md files into README.rst

Rename them to README.rst as diskimage-builder supports only .rst files,
and it might seem [1] that .md files might be considered a new dib-lint
error.

While the current README.rst might not be fully rst-compliant, there is
no documentation generated for sahara-image-elements, so this does not
cause regressions.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169992/

Change-Id: Ide764b653eb8939818e13df2778448bbe4f8f3b5

commit_message:
Use host's NTPD as the time source for NTPD on the master node

To get NTPD on master node syncronized more quickly but not abuse
external NTPD servers, let's try to use NTPD on the host where test
is running.

When master node provisioned, NTPD on the host is checked via
'ntpdate' command. If it completes successfuly, then replase
settings for NTP* servers in the /etc/fuel/astute.yaml

Change-Id: Ida6c12013bcd95a638ffc624532ea71e1716b64d
Related-Bug: #1433484

commit_message:
Fix swiftclient tests

We were not properly faking out swiftclient which lead to swift tests
passing without ever running through the swift generator code. Properly
monkey patch swiftclient so that we can test this code.

Change-Id: Ie7701cebb4c4e8ffc1289421df9c136c7de3f008

commit_message:
RMC NIC on each VM

RMC allows the management entity to provide directives to the virtual
machine, for things such as dynamically modifying resource allocations
(memory, CPU and I/O) as well as migration.  RMC runs over Ethernet.

This change set provides an additional NIC that will be deployed with
the VMs to provide the communication path for RMC.

Change-Id: I71aa328b021f0a19e27e5a7611df94896957e351

[{'created': '2015-04-02 13:53:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enhance VIOS logic to localdisk flow

Currently the VIOS logic in the localdisk would simply look for the
first Virtual I/O Server.

This enhancement enables the system to look through all of the VIOSes on
the system when determining the volume group to use.

An optional parameter was added to enable the user to specify exactly
which VIOS.  However, this is not required and is only needed if
multiple Virtual I/O Servers have a volume group of the same name.

commit_message:
Enhance VIOS logic to localdisk flow

Currently the VIOS logic in the localdisk would simply look for the
first Virtual I/O Server.

This enhancement enables the system to look through all of the VIOSes on
the system when determining the volume group to use.

An optional parameter was added to enable the user to specify exactly
which VIOS.  However, this is not required and is only needed if
multiple Virtual I/O Servers have a volume group of the same name.

Change-Id: I275384078507b85c1be884e05c08336e6cd5f534

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-25 16:48:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Modify keystone content for Kilo

Modify keystone content for Kilo as follows:

1) Replace default eventlet front-end with Apache front-end
   to provide a more production-style deployment.

   * Disable keystone service from starting up automatically
     because it creates port conflicts with Apache.
   * Use the Apache virtual host configuration template from
     the keystone source repository.
   * Use the WSGI components from the keystone source
     repository because the packages don't include them.

2) Replace SQL back-end with Memcache back-end for tokens to
   provide a more production-style deployment.

   * Remove cron job that deletes expired tokens from the SQL
     database.

3) Enable version 3 API.

   * Change "tenant" to "project" to align with v3 API
     terminology.
   * Include tests to verify operation.

4) Replace python-keystoneclient with python-openstackclient.

   * Update openrc files to work with python-openstackclient.

5) Replace password entry on CLI with prompts.

6) Move service and endpoint creation section before user and
   project creation section to improve flow.

Many of these changes stem from keystone deprecations and
recommendations from the keystone PTL. Also, this patch only
addresses Ubuntu. For other distributions, please submit
additional patches rather than modifying this patch.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I9a2e53f14d6ed41df0085256c20904760a58ea25
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-25 18:06:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Modify keystone content for Kilo

Modify keystone content for Kilo as follows:

1) Replace default eventlet front-end with Apache front-end
   to provide a more production-style deployment.

   * Disable keystone service from starting up automatically
     because it creates port conflicts with Apache.
   * Use the Apache virtual host configuration template from
     the keystone source repository.
   * Use the WSGI components from the keystone source
     repository because the packages don't include them.
   * Will update source repository links after release.

2) Replace SQL back-end with Memcache back-end for tokens to
   provide a more production-style deployment.

   * Remove cron job that deletes expired tokens from the SQL
     database.

3) Enable version 3 API.

   * Change "tenant" to "project" to align with v3 API
     terminology.
   * Include tests to verify operation.

4) Replace python-keystoneclient with python-openstackclient.

   * Update openrc files to work with python-openstackclient.

5) Replace password entry on CLI with prompts.

6) Move service and endpoint creation section before user and
   project creation section to improve flow.

Many of these changes stem from keystone deprecations and
recommendations from the keystone PTL. Also, this patch only
addresses Ubuntu. For other distributions, please submit
additional patches rather than modifying this patch.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I9a2e53f14d6ed41df0085256c20904760a58ea25
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-03-26 02:14:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Modify keystone content for Kilo

Modify keystone content for Kilo as follows:

1) Replace default eventlet front-end with Apache front-end
   to provide a more production-style deployment.

   * Disable keystone service from starting up automatically
     because it creates port conflicts with Apache.
   * Use the Apache virtual host configuration template from
     the keystone source repository.
   * Use the WSGI components from the keystone source
     repository because the packages don't include them.
   * Will update source repository links after release.

2) Replace SQL back-end with Memcache back-end for tokens to
   provide a more production-style deployment.

   * Remove cron job that deletes expired tokens from the SQL
     database.

3) Enable version 3 API.

   * Change "tenant" to "project" to align with v3 API
     terminology.
   * Include tests to verify operation.

4) Replace python-keystoneclient with python-openstackclient.

   * Update openrc files to work with python-openstackclient.

5) Replace password entry on CLI with prompts.

6) Move service and endpoint creation section before user and
   project creation section to improve flow.

Many of these changes stem from keystone deprecations and
recommendations from the keystone PTL. Also, this patch only
addresses Ubuntu. For other distributions, please submit
additional patches rather than modifying this patch.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I9a2e53f14d6ed41df0085256c20904760a58ea25

commit_message:
Modify keystone content for Kilo

Modify keystone content for Kilo as follows:

1) Replace default eventlet front-end with Apache front-end
   to provide a more production-style deployment.

   * Disable keystone service from starting up automatically
     because it creates port conflicts with Apache.
   * Use the Apache virtual host configuration template from
     the keystone source repository.
   * Use the WSGI components from the keystone source
     repository because the packages don't include them.
   * Will update source repository links after release.

2) Replace SQL back-end with Memcache back-end for tokens to
   provide a more production-style deployment.

   * Remove cron job that deletes expired tokens from the SQL
     database.

3) Enable version 3 API.

   * Change "tenant" to "project" to align with v3 API
     terminology.
   * Include tests to verify operation.

4) Replace python-keystoneclient with python-openstackclient.

   * Update openrc files to work with python-openstackclient.

5) Replace password entry on CLI with prompts.

6) Move service and endpoint creation section before user and
   project creation section to improve flow.

7) Add note about adding sections and options to default
   configuration files.

8) Disable temporary authentication token mechanism prior to
   service verification.

Many of these changes stem from keystone deprecations and
recommendations from the keystone PTL. Also, this patch only
addresses Ubuntu. For other distributions, please submit
additional patches rather than modifying this patch.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I9a2e53f14d6ed41df0085256c20904760a58ea25

commit_message:
Add index for port

This patch will speed up SELECTs Port with filters by
'network_id + device_owner' and 'network_id + mac_address'.

Closes-bug: #1421089

[{'created': '2015-04-02 18:18:44.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py'], 'message': 'Skip test_volume_boot_pattern until bug 1439806 is fixed

This test creates a bootable volume, uses it to create an instance
after which it snapshots the volume.

As a last step, the created instances are stopped. During cleanup,
the volume snapshot will be deleted while the volume is still
attached.

Nova assisted volume snapshot deletion will fail as this requires
the instance to be running.

Change-Id: I26e5837b9d5b39b8394ec2f98c280743d4c9c699
Related-Bug: #1439806
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Skip test_volume_boot_pattern until bug 1439806 is fixed

This test creates a bootable volume, uses it to create an instance
after which it snapshots the volume.

As a last step, the created instances are stopped. During cleanup,
the volume snapshot will be deleted while the volume is still
attached.

Nova assisted volume snapshot deletion will fail as this requires
the instance to be running.

Change-Id: I26e5837b9d5b39b8394ec2f98c280743d4c9c699
Related-Bug: #1439806

commit_message:
Rename cache bust argument to __CACHE_BUST__

Since migration to Gulp, commit SHA is not used to bust cache.
Instead we use current date. So we need to rename argument name
accordingly to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I33b31d69231fefff9f455d2dbbeca0230ca8dccc

commit_message:
Add API tests for subnet-create with subnetpool

With subnetpool, we can create subnet with subnetpool.
User can specify CIDR or prefixlen for subnet allocation.
If neither is specified, CIDR will be chosen from the
pool using the default-prefixlen of the pool.

Change-Id: Ifb1d51b041777554e974dc375312bf360c367d88
Depends-on: I59a221f4f434718fb77bd132dbbe1ff50fce4b0c
Partially-Implements: blueprint subnet-allocation

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-04 22:21:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add support job-types-list

This change adds support to the client for the job-types-endpoint.

commit_message:
Add support for job-types-list

This change adds support to the client for the job-types-endpoint.
Filtering by a single value for type, plugin, and version is supported.
Config hints are not available in this interface.

Change-Id: I0240717ac74c52dd915ce1617fb5d34d87660c0b
Partial-Implements: blueprint edp-job-types-endpoint

commit_message:
indexer: return objects rather than dict

We used to return dict from the indexer, and then convert them to
object, and then sometimes encoding them as JSON.

We know makes the indexer returns directly object that have the right
interface to be directly encoded as JSON. That reduces the number of
object we have to create down the path and improves performance.

This is only done for archive policies and metrics in this patch.

Change-Id: I518d822a25fd3c5494a554645a5bbbcfc58336fd

commit_message:
rest: allow to search for metric value

This adds a new REST API endpoint that allows to search for certain
values in a list of metric. It can be used to detect threshold or things
like that efficiently in multiple metrics at once without downloading
their measures.

Change-Id: I10cc41d87a3d54ba9a03a8bd1ed92671618053c4

subject: functions-libvirt: Enable DEBUG_LIBVIRT config attribute by default
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 10:08:58.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt'], 'message': 'functions-libvirt: Enable DEBUG_LIBVIRT config attribute by default

Enabling it by default because:

  - This allows you to get the relevant logs right away when something
    in the libvirt code path fails, without having to submit another
    change and keep doing a 'recheck' to re-run the CI check/gate jobs
    until you hit the bug.

  - The libvirt log filters specified in the function
    'configure_libvirt' are much more _selective_ and not a catch-all
    debug option where you end up with the unhelpful situation of having
    to find a "specific piece of hay in a haystack"[1].

FWIW, I always have it enabled in local test environments, and I don't
see the resulting libvirtd.log growing beyond a couple of MB for
three-four days of usage.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-January/024414.html

Change-Id: I5e0b35446075b419fe473e1db8d0bfedd7009741
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
functions-libvirt: Enable DEBUG_LIBVIRT config attribute by default

Enabling it by default because:

  - This allows you to get the relevant logs right away when something
    in the libvirt code path fails, without having to submit another
    change and keep doing a 'recheck' to re-run the CI check/gate jobs
    until you hit the bug.

  - The libvirt log filters specified in the function
    'configure_libvirt' are much more _selective_ and not a catch-all
    debug option where you end up with the unhelpful situation of having
    to find a "specific piece of hay in a haystack"[1].

FWIW, I always have it enabled in local test environments, and I don't
see the resulting libvirtd.log growing beyond a couple of MB for
three-four days of usage.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-January/024414.html

Change-Id: I5e0b35446075b419fe473e1db8d0bfedd7009741

commit_message:
Change default cirros ssh user

Cirros images allow connection with root and cirros by default.
Interactive sessions for root are not allowed. This will change the
default user to cirros since it allows interactive ssh sessions.

See also https://bugs.launchpad.net/cirros/+bug/1437350

Change-Id: If929ce7a3df944bd17c7f4e3042a6aea0c318b2c

commit_message:
Don't used fixed_network.py with nova-net

If nova-net is configured there isn't any reason to specify a specific
network to use since nova-net lets you start a server with multiple
networks. This commit fixes fixed_network.py not to set a network if
nova-net is in use.

Change-Id: I7351056880817a4182cda44cba9ab6d7f3c063b3

commit_message:
Add cerberus related projects

Cerberus is a security component, facilitates integration of
third-party security programs (vulnerabilty scanners)
Sticks is a cerberus plugin dedicated to ticket management
(facilitated integration of well-known ticket managers)

with cells have changed. This patch adjusts the exceptions such that
the job should pass.

The tests being removed from the whitelist had been failing in the
past because a flavor created by tempest could not be accessed in

* Shelve instance
* Rescue instance

commit_message:
Adjust regression exceptions for Nova Cells V1 job

Since several patches have merged, the set of tempest test expected
failures with cells have changed. This patch adjusts the list of
tests that should not be run in order for the job to pass.

The tests being removed from the blacklist had been failing in the
past because a flavor created by tempest could not be accessed in
child cells during instance create. Patches have since merged that
enable use of the flavor object stored in the instance object,
eliminating the need for a flavor lookup from the database. So tests
having to do only with an instance create can be removed from the list.

There are some classes of tempest tests still expected to fail in a
Cells V1 environment:

* Networks API
* Resize instance
* Floating ips
* Shelve instance
* Rescue instance

Change-Id: If32b7361521d4747dcd05db47e3bf4955ce1b232

[{'created': '2015-03-30 05:11:31.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Restore devstack centos7 to non-voting check job

This restores centos7 to a check job.  The issue with increased memory
usage is due to using using the pip version of pyOpenSSL due to
Idf3a3a914b54779172776822710b3e52e751b1d1 which blows out memory
usage; see discussion in [1].

This reverts commit 8c8d8a4d09e4568b662ace3915f89628a44450d7.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/oom-in-rax-centos7-CI-job

Change-Id: I5aa95f4a80114cc2634c14cca4eb1e0e238be320

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Restore devstack centos7 to non-voting check job

This restores centos7 to a check job.  The issue with increased memory
usage is due to using using the pip version of pyOpenSSL due to
Idf3a3a914b54779172776822710b3e52e751b1d1 which blows out memory
usage; see discussion in [1].

This reverts commit 8c8d8a4d09e4568b662ace3915f89628a44450d7.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/oom-in-rax-centos7-CI-job

Change-Id: I5aa95f4a80114cc2634c14cca4eb1e0e238be320
Depends-On: Icd4100da1d5cbdb82017da046b00b9397813c2f2

commit_message:
Add check-tempest-dsvm-heat

Because heat builds on the compute base layer, it does not need to be
tested in all devstack-gate jobs. Instead create a new job that tests
heat in a devstack environment as a first step in removing it from the
standard configuration.

Specify that heat should be enabled in the devstack updown job
so that the parts that enable heat are exercised in devstack.
This is already currently the case, but this updates the job config
so that it will continue to do so later when we remove heat from
the default config.

Change-Id: I13a80cc5b669f30f55dae67fd82eb6e3f31f9dbc

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-31 08:25:13.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Gnocchi: do not check requirements

As the Gnocchi project does not follow the integrated release schedule,
we are going to release on a different pace than most OpenStack
integrated projects. Having the requirements tight to the rest of the
schedule might very likely be an issue for deployer wanting to upgrade
Gnocchi while the rest of OpenStack isn't released yet.

So Gnocchi is going to follow its own dependency rules, while doing best
effort to be compatible with the rest of OpenStack obviously.

Change-Id: Id2836cf52b62ae22d39135ee725679c68fda06cf
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Gnocchi: do not check requirements

As the Gnocchi project does not follow the integrated release schedule,
we are going to release on a different pace than most OpenStack
integrated projects. Having the requirements tight to the rest of the
schedule might very likely be an issue for deployer wanting to upgrade
Gnocchi while the rest of OpenStack isn't released yet.

So Gnocchi is going to follow its own dependency rules, while doing best
effort to be compatible with the rest of OpenStack obviously.

Change-Id: Id2836cf52b62ae22d39135ee725679c68fda06cf

commit_message:
Switch nova-docker-f20 job to centos7

F20 nodes are having issues at the moment, and F20 is getting a bit
old anyway.  Move this to centos7 which is a better choice for
long-term testing.

Change-Id: Ifa742ba5bdae0b796b8b92336e41234fd8b7939e

commit_message:
RST: Import the HOT guide

This import requires an update to conf.py to enable the hotref
extension from os-doc-tools.

Once this guide is published, the hot-guide folder can be removed.

1) adds the user_only scope to all the files included in the toctree
in hot.rst
2) creates a separate forlder for the hot guide in the source directory
3) checks rst markuping

Change-Id: Iee6027604fb62b460ea20c7bf58b88928b1e81e1
Co-Authored-By: Gauvain Pocentek <gauvain.pocentek@objectif-libre.com>
Co-Authored-By: Olga Gusarenko <ogusarenko@mirantis.com>

[{'created': '2015-03-30 18:54:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Lists for Generic Checks

The Generic check had no way to identify
a value inside a list.  Since Lists are inherantly unstable in

Lists now follow the same approach as the OrCheck:

check fail.

If the value is nested in a dictionary under the list, all of
the subordinate dictionaries are checked in a recursive manner.

commit_message:
Lists for Generic Checks

The Generic check had no way to identify
a value inside a list.  Since Lists are inherantly unstable in
indexing, requiring an index to match is not practical.

Lists now follow the same approach as the OrCheck:
When specifying a value inside a list, each element
of the lsit is checked for a match.  If any of the sub lists match,
the check succeeds. Only if the entry is not in the list does the
check fail.

If the value is nested in a dictionary under the list, all of
the subordinate dictionaries are checked in a recursive manner.

Change-Id: Ia286dbd3757703779d7044b3003381eab6c5c919

subject: Set MySQL transaction isolation to READ_COMMITED
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14774, 'name': 'Fuel TPI CI', 'email': 'pi-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-tpi-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 10:20:50.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/mysql/templates/my.cnf.erb'], 'message': "Set MySQL transaction isolation to READ_COMMITED

A MySQL uses repeatable read for transactions by default.
A Postgres uses read committed by default, and an SQLite
uses serializable. Oslo.db don't set the isolation level
explicitly anywhere.

This is a problem as Openstack applications using Oslo.db
may be running under different isolation levels depending
on the backend type but the implicit isolation level
is unknown for Oslo.db code.

The solution is that Fuel should configure the MySQL
transaction_isolation=READ-COMMITTED as it looks that this
mode is implicit for backends by Oslo.db because it is a
standard for DB transations.

Change-Id: Ib4d22e1cdfb177ce236a89e7a6292292018052fa
Closes-bug: #1438107
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set MySQL transaction isolation to READ_COMMITED

A MySQL uses repeatable read for transactions by default.
A Postgres uses read committed by default, and an SQLite
uses serializable. Oslo.db don't set the isolation level
explicitly anywhere.

This is a problem as Openstack applications using Oslo.db
may be running under different isolation levels depending
on the backend type but the implicit isolation level
is unknown for Oslo.db code.

The solution is that Fuel should configure the MySQL
transaction_isolation=READ-COMMITTED as it looks that this
mode is implicit for backends by Oslo.db because it is a
standard for DB transations.

Change-Id: Ib4d22e1cdfb177ce236a89e7a6292292018052fa
Closes-bug: #1438107
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-22 20:25:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve ec2-api gating jobs

1. enable ec2-api-metadata service to install/screen it automatically. Steps for configuring
this services are present in the devstack plugin script. But it must be enabled to start.

2. Enable tempest for rally gate. Only tempest preparation code has needed falvors creation -
flavors without disk(m1.nano for example). We need flavor without disk because only this can be
run with fakevirt driver due to bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1433994

3. Add calling hook script before running rally to setup specific things of third-party project.
For example - botocore. This library is absent in global requirements and can not be add to ec2-api
project. And global requirements is frozen now for adding new.

Change-Id: I9993c97ecb6900efefc8ae73107d8a06a9e6dcf6

2. Add calling hook script before running rally to setup specific things of third-party project.
For example - botocore. This library is absent in global requirements and can not be add to ec2-api
project. And global requirements is frozen now for adding new.

Change-Id: I9993c97ecb6900efefc8ae73107d8a06a9e6dcf6
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Improve ec2-api gating jobs for rally testing

1. Enable tempest for rally gate. Only tempest preparation code has needed falvors creation -
flavors without disk(m1.nano for example). We need flavor without disk because only this can be
run with fakevirt driver due to bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1433994

2. Add calling hook script before running rally to setup specific things of third-party project.
For example - botocore. This library is absent in global requirements and can not be add to ec2-api
project. And global requirements is frozen now for adding new.

Change-Id: I9993c97ecb6900efefc8ae73107d8a06a9e6dcf6

commit_message:
Remove unneeded 'create' from all tags sections

Look for all keys that begin with 'refs/tags' rather than just the
string literal 'refs/tags/*' when removing unneeded create permissions
from tag access sections.

commit_message:
Add tempest + postgres job for manila

Right now Manila project is tested in CI only against MySQL DB backend.

Add new tempest job, similar to existing one, but with different
DB backend - PostgreSQL. Set it as non-voting until it becomes stable.

Change-Id: I56cbdd8173bcbc906772457bdcbbebc27c742cfe

commit_message:
Change default Ceph log file name to '$cluster-$name.log'

There is a possibility that an OSD host will run many OSD deamons, so it
is better idea to log messages to different files.

Change-Id: Ief8186006386af8ae7e40cffeeaeef5a5c0f3c70
Closes-Bug: 1428693

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-28 14:22:32.000000000', 'files': ['Vagrantfile'], 'message': 'read ip from eth1 if using host-only network

If the the vms are using host-only network, then eth1 would be the
proper interface to retrieve ip of the vm. Without these lines, the
host manager will only add 127.0.0.1 to /etc/hosts file.

Change-Id: If2f825ebb9d6f7f096ce55e1bf070e5af91f5d45
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
read ip from eth1 if using host-only network

If the the vms are using host-only network, then eth1 would be the
proper interface to retrieve ip of the vm. Without these lines, the
host manager will only add 127.0.0.1 to /etc/hosts file.

Change-Id: If2f825ebb9d6f7f096ce55e1bf070e5af91f5d45

commit_message:
Align patching tests with Fuel 6.1

Make necessary changes in tests to be able
to run them on Fuel 6.1 iso.
Also change parser for erratum.yaml, so it
recognize new modified format.

commit_message:
Rework authentication

Saharaclient's authentication is relatively simple. It resolves the
sahara URL and the token prior to making any requests.

Provide the means to use the features of the adapter directly and adopt
those features.

Change-Id: I7d0f8435b836d187a0396657b485d9d080a59ba1

commit_message:
Fixes image building, CI tests and requirements

[DIB] Add posibility to build image from specified commit of agent
Included gitpython, required by file-downloading feature
Incorrect generation of file path where to put script symlink caused
"OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory" exception to be raised
after first execution plan run

Change-Id: Ifb6dffde5afd5ad5ce363934be71c7cc1e046de2
Closes-Bug: #1439367
Closes-Bug: #1439767
Co-Authored-By: Stan Lagun <slagun@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kirill Zaitsev <kzaitsev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Prevent plugin package deletion before API unregister call

If plugin has been used in some enviroment, we should show
error and do not delete his package:

    400 Client Error: Bad Request (Can't delete plugin which is enabledfor some environment.)

Change-Id: Id0686a6332d8312d49556fdb43c66b82b4370ef4
Closes-Bug: #1430768

commit_message:
Master node UID hack

Needed for UI to map React/Backbone models
correctly on Master Node settings.

Part of Tracking feature - we need to show Master Node UID
on Support tab, but UI couldn't easily parse default settings
format. It was easier to add hack on backend rather than dance
with Javascript.

Change-Id: I298360148ffe894ade65bf8393e3d5ba3ced86b6

commit_message:
Provide a way to know the boostrap_nodeid IP

Currently it is possible to know what is the hostname of the boostrap
nodeid but not its IP. Since depending on the use case the use of the IP
might be needed, a way to have access to this information should be
provided.

Change-Id: I9d0a7ee7de2088ddb87e0d8a8ae2b3ac75b0e78d

subject: Logging not using oslo.i18n guidelines
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-18 02:33:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Logging not using oslo.i18n guidelines

As part of cleanup in Cinder there have been quite a few
instances found where the i18n guidelines are not being
followed. I believe this has helped lead to some of the
confusion around how to correctly do this. Other developers
see this code and assume it is an example of the correct
usage.

This patch attempts to clean up most of those violations
in the existing codebase to hopefully help avoid some of
that confusion in reviews.

Some issues address:
* Correct log translation markers for different log levels
* Passing format values as arguments to call, not preformatting
* Not forcing translation via six.text_type and others

Guidelines can be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Will add hacking checks in the future if they are enabled for
this project. Hacking checks would not be able to identify all
violations of the guidelines, but it could be useful for catching
obvious ones suck as LOG.info("No markers!").

Change-Id: I4d0243b3aa9852743e51d7f01a481aefc3c620a8
Partial-bug: 1433216

commit_message:
Logging not using oslo.i18n guidelines

As part of cleanup in Cinder there have been quite a few
instances found where the i18n guidelines are not being
followed. I believe this has helped lead to some of the
confusion around how to correctly do this. Other developers
see this code and assume it is an example of the correct
usage.

This patch attempts to clean up most of those violations
in the existing codebase to hopefully help avoid some of
that confusion in reviews.

Some issues address:
* Correct log translation markers for different log levels
* Passing format values as arguments to call, not preformatting
* Not forcing translation via six.text_type and others

Guidelines can be found here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Will add hacking checks in the future if they are enabled for
this project. Hacking checks would not be able to identify all
violations of the guidelines, but it could be useful for catching
obvious ones such as LOG.info("No markers!").

Change-Id: I4d0243b3aa9852743e51d7f01a481aefc3c620a8
Partial-bug: 1433216

commit_message:
Import nova's wrapper for nice testr output

Bring in the wrapper script the nova team uses so it is easier for other
projects to share. The subunit-trace command run by the script is part
of tempest-lib, so add that to our test-requirements.txt. We can't add
it to the main requirements list because tempest-lib also depends on
oslotest.

Change-Id: If14d96832f8ddc3130608abab3223aa2add7bec8

subject: Use my_ip as default URL instead of localhost
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 01:15:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use my_ip as default URl instead of localhost

python-openstackclient for ironic-discoverd fails like:
 $ openstack baremetal introspection status <uuid>
 ERROR: openstack 'utf8' codec can't decode byte 0xa5 in position 89:
 invalid start byte

When set "DISCOVERD_URL" environment value as http://<my_ip>:5050,
this error doesn't occur.
So that, the reason of this error is using localhost as default url.

This patch set fix the default url to host's URL.

Change-Id: I59e6bf30c19eee65b52e8d2bd56c148cd3b29efa
Closes-Bug: #1439468

commit_message:
Use my_ip as default URL instead of localhost

python-openstackclient for ironic-discoverd fails like:
 $ openstack baremetal introspection status <uuid>
 ERROR: openstack 'utf8' codec can't decode byte 0xa5 in position 89:
 invalid start byte

When set "DISCOVERD_URL" environment value as http://<my_ip>:5050,
this error doesn't occur.
So that, the reason of this error is using localhost as default url.

This patch set fix the default url to host's URL.

Change-Id: I59e6bf30c19eee65b52e8d2bd56c148cd3b29efa
Closes-Bug: #1439468

commit_message:
Make the msgpackutils handlers more extendable

This change revamps the current serialization and
deserialization functions to be tiny objects that
have the ability to serialize there expected types.

It also adds a registry of these handlers objects
and allows for passing a registry into the dumps
and loads methods for people that want to add there
own handlers on.

Change-Id: Ib1a8a507c6c3d4f0372114d67163d3f2ab495c9f

commit_message:
Expand valid server group name character set

Names requested for a server group should use the same validation
checking as names in the other APIS. Right now it will not allow
any non alphanumeric characters. Change this to allow all printable
and horizontal whitespace unicode characters. This is the same check
that is done for flavor names, as well as names in v2.1 APIs.
Closes-Bug: #1434335

Change-Id: I6c675fb6c2f40e83499a41ecdccec58d99501433

commit_message:
Revert of gateways for VIPs

This commit sets default route for public interfaces
and also sets static routes for haproxy namespaces to
the networks which are connected to the host directly
with metric of 10000 to ensure that these routes do
not override routes installed by kernel on interfaces
configuration stage

Regression caused by fix of
https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1433150

Change-Id: I7df8efad4aa119896314e77c29d9b024599dc865
Closes-Bug: 1431547

commit_message:
Extended check for 'ceph-osd' that doesn't have a parent host.

If ceph-ods creation process is interrupted, then one of ceph-osd
can be added not correctly and will not have a parent node.

Change-Id: I8c447072d2309c7017209e5478228719bc65ede6
Closes-Bug: #1437990

commit_message:
Allow node interfaces update if it's in 'discover' or 'error' state

Node inferfaces update is allowed when node is in one of the following states:
'discover', 'error'. It's locked for other node states.
It's not locked on node creation, i.e. when node.nic_interfaces is empty yet.

Closes-Bug: #1425901
Closes-Bug: #1428776
Change-Id: Icc60c432296c28e89d71b1fd0dd864870553a467

commit_message:
Bump last version of ceilometer-client

All Ceilometer resources in Heat can not be used 
(created, deleted, ...) if ceilometerclient has version 1.0.12.
So it leads to blocking autoscaling mechanism, where ceilometer's
resources are used.
It happens due to huge time interval between 1.0.12 and 1.0.13 
ceilometerclient versions. 
This change change lower version from 1.0.12 to 1.0.13, which fix 
mentioned above issue.


Change-Id: I670e0d4dd98b087e0f87696b0c28044f1b4d9c00
Closes-Bug: #1423291

commit_message:
Fix functional test using local timeout value

The ovsdb monitor test was using a timeout of 60s for monitor start.
This change sets the timeout to the global timeout value if it is
greater (it's 90s currently).

Closes-bug: #1439914

Change-Id: I95ee3d7dfdb5f010347a9d8db1b2bf610c0289d1

commit_message:
Move common resource attributes into a mixin

This change creates a mixin to share configuration and
resource attributes of a resource extention.

Change-Id: Ib9a48280a8e7ee7720c51e12d87bca7874dcf393

commit_message:
Fix typo in neutron.conf.j2

Currently, neutron.conf.j2 tries to do a substitution on $(tenant_id)s
but this should be %(tenant_id)s.  This results in some 404s as neutron
ends up trying to hit
http://<ip>:8774/v2/%(tenant_id)s/<tenant_id>/os-server-external-events
instead of http://<ip>:8774/v2/<tenant_id>/os-server-external-events.

Change-Id: Ia70d93d2f1057795a0ba197da4421f0fc2639cd2
Closes-Bug: #1439748

subject: Adjust ResourcesController to provide get_all()
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 18:34:44.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/rest/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/tests/gabbi/gabbits/resource.yaml'], 'message': "Adjust ResourcesController to provide get_all()

When using index() a request to /v1/resource will redirect to
/v1/resources/ and then give information. Since we don't appear to
be redirecting to trailing slashes anywhere else, this appear to be an
inconsistency we don't want.

Change-Id: I6d8a94b36093d4cfae31ad1a10d3da10e1fa1683
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adjust ResourcesController to provide get_all()

When using index() a request to /v1/resource will redirect to
/v1/resources/ and then give information. Since we don't appear to
be redirecting to trailing slashes anywhere else, this appear to be an
inconsistency we don't want.

Change-Id: I6d8a94b36093d4cfae31ad1a10d3da10e1fa1683

commit_message:
Fixes bug in Federation list projects endpoint

'/OS-FEDERATION/projects' and '/auth/projects'
API endpoints did not honor project inherited
group role assignments.

This patch fixed this bug.

Closes-Bug: #1424500

Change-Id: I4937289362122952d1b3e1b73c5712601c675bb4

commit_message:
Exposes bug in Federation list projects endpoint

'/OS-FEDERATION/projects' and '/auth/projects'
API endpoints do not honor project inherited
group role assignments.

This patch exposes this bug and a follow-on patch
will fix it.

Related-Bug: #1424500

Change-Id: Idd6827bc5552192f04de19e8a78fb462bdde380f

One of performance tests was trying to change NICs for nodes
in 'ready' state which now is not possible.

commit_message:
Fix invalid operation on NICs in performance tests

One of performance tests was trying to change NICs for nodes
in 'ready' state which now is not possible.
Nodes will be now in 'discover' state for this test.

Change-Id: I61f0193d5df0f75ad8a210489f6aa27be3f82342
Closes-Bug: #1439540

commit_message:
Raise exception when backup volume-backed instance

This patch will be backported to Juno and Icehouse so that
Nova can fail immediately to let user know that it's not
supported in that release.

Partial-Bug: #1313573

.driver didn't need to be used here. The Manager automatically

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-22 13:46:54.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/resource/core.py', 'keystone/assignment/core.py', 'keystone/cli.py'], 'message': "Cleanup use of .driver

Unless being used to override the Manager implementation, .driver
doesn't need to be used because the Manager automatically
forwards calls to the driver. The code shouldn't use .driver
directly where it's not necessary since developers should be
able to override behavior in the Manager, which we've done
several times (for deprecations or reorganization for
example).

Change-Id: I05b13d4f4ec7e6be8e72b73bac164333535aebee
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Cleanup use of .driver

Unless being used to override the Manager implementation, .driver
doesn't need to be used because the Manager automatically
forwards calls to the driver. The code shouldn't use .driver
directly where it's not necessary since developers should be
able to override behavior in the Manager, which we've done
several times (for deprecations or reorganization for
example).

Change-Id: I05b13d4f4ec7e6be8e72b73bac164333535aebee

commit_message:
Ignore 404 error and lower a warning log to info

Ignore an expected 404 error. Lower the severity of an informational log entry
from warning to info to avoid polluting the server.log

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/bigswitch/servermanager.py

Closes-Bug: #1413457
Change-Id: Ib6316cdda0aed10d8f430790b0c4f909ad833eb0
(cherry picked from commit 705b76d02db318ecedcbd96d09af9785f14429ee)

commit_message:
Remove 'tenant' from RequestContext

This patch completely removes 'tenant' from the RequestContext.
Now we should be able to detect where the old-style references are
still alive.

commit_message:
Warn if boot volume AZ differs from instance AZ

For the Launch Instance source step, this patch adds the availability
zone column to the transfer table when a volume is selected as a boot
source. It also will display a warning icon next to the volume's AZ
name if it differs than the selected instance AZ. When hovering over
the warning icon it will reveal a toolip reminding the user to ensure
the selected AZ is compatible with the volume AZ.

Closes-Bug: 1437535
Change-Id: I2f5f2672d976bfb274d7dfe22f455fd2cab823d5

commit_message:
Replace 'tenant' by 'project'

This patch replaces the occurence of 'tenant' by 'project'. There
are still some places 'tenant' have to be used. Will try remove them
when possible and necessary.

commit_message:
Make json argument in container-create command positional

Currently, execute "magnum container-create" command will hangs on
because the json argument is optional.

The json should be a positional argument as this patch did.

Change-Id: I97ad2cf1c3b3e7edc978920a54edd9bb3dc9d287
Closes-bug: #1439943

commit_message:
Compare to the right heat status when bay CREATE_FAILED

Currently, we used "FAILED" when the bay create failed.
But in heat, the status should be "CREATE_FAILED", it cause the
poll_and_check method won't stop looping when one bay create
failed.

This patch change "FAILED" to "CREATE_FAILED"

Change-Id: I670b1149a04f497be9fc739398fec8c6e9f73f36
Closes-bug: #1439924

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-29 21:04:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Reconstructor helpers for handoff revert case (and other misc)

In a continuing series to build up the reconstructor, this patch:

- moves the reconstructor to using its own .conf files instead of
sharing with the object server.  This is needed to facilitate its
having a proxy pipeline for using InternalClient

- add a .conf file just for the recon proxy pipeline to be shared
by all of the daemons.   It.s a little goofy and there are several
alternatives so am open to anyone who has a real issue with
this to pushing one of the alternates

- adds a helper to HEAD all primaries for a given hash to get
their fragment archive index

- adds a helper to decide which node to revert to based on
local fragment archive index and what else is out there

- changes to update_deleted() to use the new helpers

- updated test code to use the test rings created as part of
the patched policies

The Current WIP:

- sample.conf files need to be updated
- testing, need to review the algorithms here used in
  update_deleted for sanity

blueprint ec-reconstructor

Change-Id: I7d15620dc66ee646b223bb9fff700796cd6bef51
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-11-18 23:14:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Reconstructor helpers for handoff revert case (and other misc)

** Major WIP here.  Just posting to help facilitate discussion
on some of the scenarios talked about in Paris and some
possible solutions. **

In a continuing series to build up the reconstructor, this patch
really focuses on making sure that reverting data to another
primary (based on being an old handoff or because of rebalance)
works (send the right data to the right places w/o crazy overhead
and without overwriting another fragment archive of a different
index)

- moves the reconstructor to using its own .conf files instead of
sharing with the object server.  This is needed to facilitate its
having a proxy pipeline for using InternalClient which based on
some recent design changes may/may not be needed and will be
addressed when the patch is code complete

- add a .conf file just for the recon proxy pipeline to be shared
by all of the daemons.   It.s a little goofy and there are several
alternatives so am open to anyone who has a real issue with
this to pushing one of the alternates.  If no internal client is
needed will remove this.

- added in a current "in review" node/FI pairing patch which is
functionally needed for the rest of this to make any sense

- pulled in a lot of test_diskfile.py changes and plumbing from
another WIP (soon to be abandoned) patch that setup a per policy
flag to define "auto delete" or not.  That actual functionality
doesn't make sense right now but most (maybe not all) of the
policy index plumbing into various diskfile methods is needed by
this patch so I just lifted it all in tact.  Will revert any
un-needed policy_index parameter passing when this is code complete,
wanted to maintain the integrity of the patch that I merged in as
it was already tested/verified/approved

- added a per policy timestamp/filename morpher so that the FI for
EC policies now appears appended to the timestamp (for repl its
nothing).  The changes includes the required plumbing for basic
functionality using the new ts/name however its not fully tested
by a long shot

- added a "stamp file" (name can be adjusted later).  The idea is
that diskfile drops a zero byte file to indicate the FI number
of any object written to a particular partition.  The file is used
by the reconstructor for reverting data to the right primary without
having to communicate with other nodes or walk the whole freaking
partition tree.  When its identified the need to shovel a partition
off to somewhere else, it chooses the nodes to sync with based on
using the stamp number (I have at least one FI #n here somewhere) as
an index into the primary partition node list.

- changes to update_deleted() in the reconstructor so that it can
do its basic job of pushing data off to where it belongs once a
job has been constructed indicating such based on whether the local
partition is supposed to live here or not (same as repl)

- updated test code to use the test rings created as part of
the patched policies and minimally added test code in some of the
cases above

The Current WIP:

- functional developer test of all the stuff above.  Once that's done
(have minimally checked all of it as its being developed, the basic
functionality does work) will sanity check the design and write the
test code.

blueprint ec-reconstructor

Change-Id: I7d15620dc66ee646b223bb9fff700796cd6bef51
