', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-12-07 17:37:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Reconstructor helpers for handoff revert case (and other misc)

** Major WIP here.  Just posting to help facilitate discussion
on some of the scenarios talked about in Paris and some
possible solutions. **

In a continuing series to build up the reconstructor, this patch
really focuses on making sure that reverting data to another
primary (based on being an old handoff or because of rebalance)
works (send the right data to the right places w/o crazy overhead
and without overwriting another fragment archive of a different
index)

- moves the reconstructor to using its own .conf files instead of
sharing with the object server.  This is needed to facilitate its
having a proxy pipeline for using InternalClient which based on
some recent design changes may/may not be needed and will be
addressed when the patch is code complete

- add a .conf file just for the recon proxy pipeline to be shared
by all of the daemons.   It.s a little goofy and there are several
alternatives so am open to anyone who has a real issue with
this to pushing one of the alternates.  If no internal client is
needed will remove this.

- added in a current "in review" node/FI pairing patch which is
functionally needed for the rest of this to make any sense

- pulled in a lot of test_diskfile.py changes and plumbing from
another WIP (soon to be abandoned) patch that setup a per policy
flag to define "auto delete" or not.  That actual functionality
doesn't make sense right now but most (maybe not all) of the
policy index plumbing into various diskfile methods is needed by
this patch so I just lifted it all in tact.  Will revert any
un-needed policy_index parameter passing when this is code complete,
wanted to maintain the integrity of the patch that I merged in as
it was already tested/verified/approved

- added a per policy timestamp/filename morpher so that the FI for
EC policies now appears appended to the timestamp (for repl its
nothing).  The changes includes the required plumbing for basic
functionality using the new ts/name however its not fully tested
by a long shot

- added a "stamp file" (name can be adjusted later).  The idea is
that diskfile drops a zero byte file to indicate the FI number
of any object written to a particular partition.  The file is used
by the reconstructor for reverting data to the right primary without
having to communicate with other nodes or walk the whole freaking
partition tree.  When its identified the need to shovel a partition
off to somewhere else, it chooses the nodes to sync with based on
using the stamp number (I have at least one FI #n here somewhere) as
an index into the primary partition node list.

- changes to update_deleted() in the reconstructor so that it can
do its basic job of pushing data off to where it belongs once a
job has been constructed indicating such based on whether the local
partition is supposed to live here or not (same as repl)

- updated test code to use the test rings created as part of
the patched policies and minimally added test code in some of the
cases above

- new hashes.pkl format using new SuffixHashes class that supports
both replication style and EC style.  The class is mainly 2 dicts,
one indexed by suffix and one indexed by fragment number.  The
values in both cases are another dict that contains the hash info.
When stored, the class is pickled as a single dict (by suffix) to
avoid pickling duplicate information.  The by_fragment dict is
built up using by by_suffix information on demand and can be changed
to be "more lazy" as we iterate on the patch...

The Current WIP:

- functional developer test of all the stuff above.  Once that's done
(have minimally checked all of it as its being developed, the basic
functionality does work) will sanity check the design and write the
test code.

- a lot of the internal client support may be yanked before ready
for final review.  We may only need direct client for reconstructor
which will simplify some of this patch for sure

- moves the reconstructor to using its own .conf files instead of
sharing with the object server.  This is needed to facilitate its
having a proxy pipeline for using InternalClient (may or may

- add a .conf file just for the recon proxy pipeline to be shared

but that.s all new). The class is mainly 2 dicts, one indexed by suffix and

functionality does work) will sanity check the design and write the
test code. NOTE: existing test code has already been updated to work
with the hashes.pkl changes.

', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2014-12-29 22:40:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'New hashes.pkl format and several other reconstructor related changes

** STILL WIP.  Just posting to help facilitate discussions, next steps **

In a continuing series to build up the reconstructor, this patch
really focuses on making sure that reverting data to another
primary (based on being an old handoff or because of rebalance)
works (send the right data to the right places w/o crazy overhead
and without overwriting another fragment archive of a different
index).  To that end several new ideas are introduced (note that
there are a few other reconstructor related misc items here as
well):

- moves the reconstructor to using its own .conf files instead of
sharing with the object server.  This is needed to facilitate its
having a proxy pipeline for using InternalClient (may or may
not end up keeping this)

- add a .conf file just for the recon proxy pipeline to be shared
by all of the daemons.   It.s a little goofy and there are several
alternatives so am open to anyone who has a real issue with
this to pushing one of the alternates.  If no internal client is
needed will remove this.

- added in a current "in review" node/FI pairing patch which is
functionally needed for the rest of this to make any sense

- pulled in a lot of test_diskfile.py changes and plumbing from
another WIP (soon to be abandoned) patch that setup a per policy
flag to define "auto delete" or not.  That actual functionality
doesn't make sense right now but most (maybe not all) of the
policy index plumbing into various diskfile methods is needed by
this patch so I just lifted it all in tact.

- added a per policy timestamp/filename morpher so that the FI for
EC policies now appears appended to the timestamp (for repl its
nothing).  The changes includes the required plumbing for basic
functionality using the new ts/name however its not fully tested

- changes to update_deleted() in the reconstructor so that it can
do its basic job of pushing data off to where it belongs once a
job has been constructed indicating such based on whether the local
partition is supposed to live here or not.

- changes to update() in the reconstructor to facilitate reconstruction.

- changes to sssync to support EC reconstruction

- addition of reconstruct_fa() function called from ssync_sender that
performs the actual reconstruction prior to sending the object over to
the receiver

- new hashes.pkl class for use by both recon and repl, see SuffixHashes.
All of the code needed to support the new style is also included and
affects mainly Diskfile, and the replicator (well, the reconstructor too
but that.s all new). The class is mainly 2 dicts, one indexed by suffix and
one indexed by fragment number.  The values in both cases are another d
ict that contains the hash info. When stored, the class is pickled as a single
dict (by suffix) to avoid pickling duplicate information.  The by_fragment dict is
built up using by by_suffix information on demand by the reconstructor

- updated test code to use the test rings created as part of
the patched policies and minimally added test code in some of the
cases above

The Current WIP:
- developer test of all the stuff above.  Once that's done
(have minimally checked all of it as its being developed, the basic
functionality does work) will sanity check the design and write the
test code. NOTE: existing test code has already been updated to work
with the hashes.pkl changes.

', 'number': 16}, {'created': '2015-01-20 00:20:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'New hashes.pkl format and other reconstructor changes

** STILL WIP.  Just posting to help facilitate discussions,
next steps **

In a continuing series to build up the reconstructor, this patch
started focusing on just one thing but quickly grew as there are
many dependencies between the various smaller portions of the
reconstructor and I felt it would be easier to see them all in
this one patch than try to manage a ton of smaller ones.  We will
see how reviews go and adjust accordingly of course.

Here's a run down of the big things in here:

- pulled in a lot of test_diskfile.py changes and plumbing from
another WIP (soon to be abandoned) patch that setup a per policy
flag to define "auto delete" or not.  That actual functionality
doesn't make sense right now but most (maybe not all) of the
policy index plumbing into various diskfile methods is needed by
this patch so I just lifted it all in tact.

- added a per policy timestamp/filename morpher so that the FI for
EC policies now appears appended to the timestamp (for repl its
nothing).  The changes includes the required plumbing for basic
functionality using the new ts/name however its not fully tested

- addition of reconstruct_fa() function called from ssync_sender that
performs the actual reconstruction while sending the object over to
the receiver

- guts of reconstructor sorta follow replicator but there's not a
notiong of update() and upate_deleted().  This area is WIP but
heading towards a single per part+FI job and a single job processor
that just does the right thing based on an analysis of hashes.pkl.
Currently there is a job builder that is collecting all of the info
needed (suspected) by the yet-to-be-written job processor.

- new hashes.pkl class for use by both recon and repl, see SuffixHashes.
All of the code needed to support the new style is also included and
affects mainly Diskfile, and the replicator (well, the reconstructor too
but that.s all new). The class is mainly 2 dicts, one indexed by suffix and
one indexed by fragment number.  The values in both cases are another d
ict that contains the hash info. When stored, the class is pickled as a single
dict (by suffix) to avoid pickling duplicate information.  The by_fragment dict is
built up using by by_suffix information on demand by the reconstructor

- updated test code to use the test rings created as part of
the patched policies and minimally added test code in some of the
cases above

- added ability to have multiple FI's co-exist in a single hash dir.  This is
sort of prrof-of-concept mode right now but essentially:
    - proxy will place the node index that of the node its talking to for
      get/head so that when the object server gets a diskfile object it
      can indicate which FI it wants in the event that there are others there
    - for the PUT path the FI is not needed up front when instantiating a
      diskfile because nothing needs to be opened first.  So, as before, the
      FI used to create the filename in the hash dir is from the EC metadata
      sent in the trailer of the PUT
    - "need to look at closely" changes to diskfile routines like
      get_ondisk_files() as this is where it gets a little hairy

The Current WIP:
- developer test of all the stuff above.  Once that's done
(have minimally checked all of it as its being developed, the basic
functionality does work) will sanity check the design and write the
test code. NOTE: existing test code has already been updated to work
with the hashes.pkl changes.

the patched policies and minimally added test code in some of the
cases above

- added ability to have multiple FI's co-exist in a single hash dir.  This is
sort of prrof-of-concept mode right now but essentially:
    - proxy will place the node index that of the node its talking to for
      get/head so that when the object server gets a diskfile object it
      can indicate which FI it wants in the event that there are others there
    - for the PUT path the FI is not needed up front when instantiating a
      diskfile because nothing needs to be opened first.  So, as before, the
      FI used to create the filename in the hash dir is from the EC metadata
      sent in the trailer of the PUT
    - "need to look at closely" changes to diskfile routines like
      get_ondisk_files() as this is where it gets a little hairy

- various ssync changes needed for both the reconstructor and the ability to
support multiple FI per object hash dir.  One TODO here is to address
the 'rolling upgrade' issue that currently exists with the code as is because
of a change to the ssync protocol.

The Current WIP:
- developer test of all the stuff above.  Once that's done
(have minimally checked all of it as its being developed, the basic
functionality does work) will sanity check the design and write the
test code. NOTE: existing test code has already been updated to work
with the hashes.pkl changes.
- address ssync interface change to handle rolling upgrades
- several conditional 'hacks' exist now to enable full functionality of the
reconstructor, many can be tweaked for elegance...

the 'rolling upgrade' issue that currently exists with the code as is because
of a change to the ssync protocol.

The Current WIP:
- developer test of all the stuff above.  Once that's done
(have minimally checked all of it as its being developed, the basic
functionality does work) will sanity check the design and write the
test code - well continue to write it, its the main WIP.
- address ssync interface change to handle rolling upgrades
- several conditional 'hacks' exist now to enable full functionality of the
reconstructor, many can be tweaked for elegance...

the receiver

notiong of update() and upate_deleted().  This area is WIP but
heading towards a single per part+FI job and a single job processor
that just does the right thing based on an analysis of hashes.pkl.
Currently there is a job builder that is collecting all of the info
needed (suspected) by the job processor which is also currently
working for basic test cases of reconstruction and reversion.  Some
of the looping logic is still WIP in this section.

- various ssync changes needed for both the reconstructor and the ability to
support multiple FI per object hash dir.  One TODO here is to address
the 'rolling upgrade' issue that currently exists with the code as is because
of a change to the ssync protocol.

functionality does work) will sanity check the design and write the
test code - well continue to write it, its the main WIP.
- address ssync interface change to handle rolling upgrades
- several conditional 'hacks' exist now to enable full functionality of the
reconstructor, many can be tweaked for elegance...

", 'number': 31}, {'created': '2015-03-19 21:41:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Erasure Code Reconstructor

** STILL WIP debugging w/probe tests **

Here's a run down of the big things in here:

- addition of reconstruct_fa() function called from ssync_sender that
performs the actual reconstruction while sending the object over to
the receiver

- guts of reconstructor sorta follow replicator but there's not a
notiong of update() and upate_deleted().  There is a single job
processor and jobs are processed partition by partition.  At the
end of processing a partition, the ECrecon will try to remove it
and it may or may not work depending on whether everything was
deleted or not (conditionally on whether the job was moving data
or syncing)

- various ssync changes that correspond to what the ECRecon is doing
and how multi-FI support is built in.

The Current WIP:
- still based on a dependency that we'll likely replace with another
patch chain so this patch will be WIP until its time to move over
- developer test of all the stuff above
- probe tests are WIP on another patch and work in conjunction with this
on.  More are being added and this patch updated as issues are found.

end of processing a partition, the ECrecon will try to remove it
and it may or may not work depending on whether everything was
deleted or not (conditionally on whether the job was moving data
or syncing)

- various ssync changes that correspond to what the ECRecon is doing
and how multi-FI support is built in but most of those are on a
different patch

There are still opportunities to add unit tests

blueprint ec-reconstructor
Change-Id: I7d15620dc66ee646b223bb9fff700796cd6bef51
", 'number': 56}]
commit_message:
Erasure Code Reconstructor

Here's a run down of the big things in here:

- addition of reconstruct_fa() function called from ssync_sender that
performs the actual reconstruction while sending the object over to
the receiver

- guts of reconstructor sorta follow replicator but there's not a
notiong of update() and upate_deleted().  There is a single job
processor and jobs are processed partition by partition.  At the
end of processing a partition, the ECrecon will try to remove it
and it may or may not work depending on whether everything was
deleted or not (conditionally on whether the job was moving data
or syncing)

- various ssync changes that correspond to what the ECRecon is doing
and how multi-FI support is built in but most of those are on a
different patch

There are still opportunities to add unit tests

blueprint ec-reconstructor
Change-Id: I7d15620dc66ee646b223bb9fff700796cd6bef51

commit_message:
Hash token only for ASN1 and PKIZ tokens

Hashing the token only works if the token is ASN1 or PKIZ.
Check the token format instead of naively checking the token
length if it needs to be hashed.

Change-Id: I1c7bb3a1b6e1da30c241a4813bf7544695bd4fab
Closes-Bug: #1439499

commit_message:
Fix setting default log levels

The default log level override wasn't sticking around because
oslo.config resets the config when calling CONF(). We need to use
set_default instead of setting the value directly.

Change-Id: I43e12134027a657e8f2905ef4fa866332a7fb1dc

commit_message:
port_fault_status and switch_fault_status

port_fault_status and switch_fault_status implementation.
reflect the same status in neutron db from ovsdb.
raises appropriate error message while creating l2gateway connection
if switch_fault_status and port_fault_status is not UP.

Change-Id: Icc77392afeb62bd2b0b0b816a63f8f02b442b0d8

commit_message:
Add API tests for Neutron DVR extension

This patch adds a number of positive and negative tests for
the DVR functionality implemented by Neutron.

Generated using:

./tools/copy_api_tests_from_tempest.sh [path to tempest working directory]

Change-Id: Ia300b736250249ba54bd8fefa1307e6898f71652

In some case the string "<host>:<port>" are omitted in HTTP
header, if the port is included in the Host header sent in
the request, it must be included in the generated string.

There is no sanity signature method escapes the colon and port
when them are actually included in the sign request.

commit_message:
Fix errors in ec2 signature logic checking

- Check for colon in credentials['host'] instead of
credentials['signature'].
- Fix the syntax issue when trying to get the signature
from the dict.
- credentials['signature'] is not guaranteed to existed,
so check it explicitly.
- Need to reinitialize 'signer' to avoid contaminated status
of signature.

Closes-Bug: #1289115
Closes-Bug: #1434599
Change-Id: Idb5d97c30a20872fdaafea786bcea2631d70858c

commit_message:
Sync with new kilo sections

Trying to stay in sync with base, many section changes in kilo.

* Remove all unused key=value, as they making diff a nightmare
* Put in ALL section headers, makes diff easier each time
* Did NOT change any defaults or logic
* Updated spec to use specific section matching to unsure correctness

To see the diff, just diff template against base sample here:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/plain/etc/keystone.conf.sample

Change-Id: Iec379ddac6749ed9d4aea1a5501f9986845afce1
Closes-Bug: #1433717

commit_message:
Make room for functional tests

We need to consolidate the unit tests into a separate
directory so we can run just the unit tests in our py27
tox target. And we can in subsequent reviews add a parallel
directory with functional tests.

Related-Bug: #1439621
Change-Id: I8bf5af953fb31080096c371966f7dfda9edb1bf4

Change back from oslo.messaging to kombu

Use work queues instead of RPC casts to improve the API performance.

subject: Libvirt SMB volume driver: fix volume attach
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-27 16:16:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Libvirt SMB volume driver: fix volume attach

The Libvirt SMB volume driver fails to attach volumes if the
connection info does not contain mount options.

The reason is that the mount options are not parsed correctly.
It attempts to join the connection info mount options (which in
this case are set to None) with the locally configured mount
options.

This patch handles the case when the mount options are set to None.

Change-Id: I3166ef5420409ad45cf64f04e6c1d30b6c674d20
Closes-Bug: #1437389
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Libvirt SMB volume driver: fix volume attach

The Libvirt SMB volume driver fails to attach volumes if the
connection info does not contain mount options.

The reason is that the mount options are not parsed correctly.
It attempts to join the connection info mount options (which in
this case are set to None) with the locally configured mount
options.

This patch handles the case when the mount options are set to None.

Change-Id: I3166ef5420409ad45cf64f04e6c1d30b6c674d20
Closes-Bug: #1437389

commit_message:
Fixes cinder backend support for backends without a volume_group key

Currently we allow multiple cinder backends to be configured. Some
do not need a volume_group defined. This patch fixes the logic around
when we add a volume group device to cinder (only when defined)

Change-Id: I118546e8bc6c3fa7fac62b96ea2295a76711e0f3
Closes-Bug: 1439843

commit_message:
PCI tracker: make O(M * N) clean_usage algo linear

By using sets instead of lists we can cut the runtime of a piece of code
that runs on every periodic resource update form quadratic to linear.
Easy win.

commit_message:
Add help text for vcpu hours

In overview page, disk hours and ram hours has help text.
Also add help text for vcpu hours.

Change-Id: Ic44cf8753a0deebc30f7087e2e54bab6dfde5284
Closes-bug:#1417856

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-14 21:48:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactoring of L3 agent notifications for router

This is the first part of refactoring the L3 agent so that
it uses the new neutron.callbacks mechanism. To do this,
duplicate calls will be made for notifications related to
the router, only using the new callback mechanism.

As a first change (and since it is in Neutron), the metadata
proxy is modified to make use of the new mechanism, instead
of the event_notifier for the callbacks. Afterwards, separate
commits will be made in the *aaS repos, and when all of them
are migrated, the old callbacks can be removed.

Change-Id: If134947957fd671aa99a0b2d2b37f7ec65e37766
Partially-Implements: bp/restructure-l3-agent

it uses the new neutron.callbacks mechanism. To do this,
duplicate calls will be made for notifications related to

callback mechanism, and to then remove the old callback
mechanism, once no longer used.

commit_message:
Refactoring of L3 agent notifications for router

The goal of this refactoring is to reduce duplication by
replacing the L3EventObservers mechanism (a specific
mechanism for L3 agent notifications), with the
CallbacksManager mechanism (a more general mechanism
currently in use), so that there is one method
used.

This is the first part of refactoring the L3 agent so that
it uses the new neutron.callbacks mechanism. To do this,
duplicate calls will be made for notifications related to
the router, only using the new callback mechanism.

This commit does two things. First, it puts in place the
notifiers for the new callback mechanism. Second, it updates
the metatdata proxy agent (which is in the same repo) to
use the new callback mechanism.

Later commits will update other repos from the old to new
callback mechanism, and to then remove the old callback
mechanism, once no longer used.

Change-Id: If134947957fd671aa99a0b2d2b37f7ec65e37766
Partial-Bug: #1433552

commit_message:
Fix test cases still use v3 prefix

After commit e03cfed720a2424ea9ce2819fa06c2d423e9100c
the prefix of v3 API was changed to os_compute_api
so prefix in test cases should be changed as well.
This patch changed test_cells, test_extended_volumes,
test_simple_tenant_usage and test_used_limits.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I793f6bbb35ab868d05224e4076befe981b19d537

commit_message:
Lazy import of keystoneclient in osclients

* Move import from keystoneclient to create_keystone_client method
in osclients. This is done to avoid loading keystoneclient on Rally
start to make it starts faster.
* Move import of exceptions from keystoneclient to verified_keystone
method.
* Add unit tests for function create_keystone_client

Implements: blueprint lazy-imports

Change-Id: Ie11618b380a9a51c5b6e237179b4da8b7178d16b

subject: Add and use ansible module for docker-compose
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-31 03:24:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add and use ansible module for docker-compose

This ansible module for docker-compose allows for idempotency. I have
submitted a pull request upstream to ansible-modules-extra to include
this new module. When/if the module is accepted upstream if can be
removed from the local module library.

The two playbooks have been updated to use this module. The database
data container does not support idempotency due to the fact that it
exists instead of sleeps. Therefore each time `docker-compose up` is
called, it will start the container and register a change. The
message-broker does not have this issue and will remain unchanged even
repeatedly running these playbooks.

commit_message:
Add and use ansible module for docker-compose

This ansible module for docker-compose allows for idempotency. I have
submitted a pull request upstream to ansible-modules-extra to include
this new module. When/if the module is accepted upstream if can be
removed from the local module library.

The two playbooks have been updated to use this module. The database
data container does not support idempotency due to the fact that it
exists instead of sleeps. Therefore each time `docker-compose up` is
called, it will start the container and register a change. The
message-broker does not have this issue and will remain unchanged even
repeatedly running these playbooks.

Due to the use of a special branch of docker-compose provided by sdake,
this module requires at least docker-compose==1.2.0rc1

Change-Id: If1644eaa3bff0c2a007fa2d479a95bea941945f6

Updating .coveragerc to exclude the tests

This change excludes the neutron_lbaas/tests* directory from the
coverage report.  The tests artificially inflate the numbers as the
tests will always run.

commit_message:
Re-reading OVSDB data when agent heart beats fail

The patch set converts the Monitor L2gateway agent to the
transact agent when the Neutron server is disconnected
from the Rabbit MQ bus, and the L2gateway Monitor agent
is not able to report its state to the Neutron server.
When the Neutron server connects back to the bus, it selects
a particular agent as the Monitor agent and the OVSDB server
data is re-read so as to get the up-to-date view of the data.

Change-Id: Idd662d35ffee8e91cba7800b88d27359f3d98138

commit_message:
Rename test_live_block_migration to test_live_migration

These tests can actually test both block and regular live migration, so
update the filename to reflect that.

Also move test to admin, since by default migration is a admin only API call

Change-Id: Ibdae2e8ba9b537ed721bc4448d7107d3f8eaf013

commit_message:
fix the websocket_bad_token test

_fake_getheader should read _fake_getheader_bad_token for this
test

This commit doesn't affect master, as this issue doesn't exist in
master. This bug occured during the backport of the commit [1], which
was altered from the original commit.

        [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163034/3

Closes-Bug: 1434696

Change-Id: I40c0ec6b1728ff3a3195e7fbc4525c8a4220ddc0

commit_message:
Fix up _ldap_res_to_model for ldap identity backend

If a user specifies a user enabled attribute, then conditional
for checking if it's a string is insufficient, and will always
come back as False, since it's referencing the method, and not
actually calling it.

Closes-Bug: #1415271
  (cherry picked from commit ad9ecdbab9ab4243477aeac8a92214cb1ac830c6)

Change-Id: I4ea48929bc175b40ddb706e7750661a57882ed6b

commit_message:
Changed target version of NovaCompute object during Service backport

When backporting a Service object to Icehouse version the embedded
ComputeNode object was being sent back at the wrong version.
It happens because ComputeNode object is too new for Icehouse.
Icehouse ComputeNode object is 1.3 not 1.4.
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/objects/compute_node.py?h=stable/icehouse#n27

Closes-Bug: #1408496

Change-Id: I33d9b29e9342b5aac2644a36bf2f4d637cc8ba53

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V: configdrive is not migrated to destination

When live-migrating an instance with a iso configdrive, that
configdrive is not migrated to the host, even though it is
attached to the instance.

This fix assures that if the instance has a iso configdrive
attached the iso file is also moved during live migration.

Fixes-Bug: 1322096
Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_pathutils.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/livemigrationops.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/pathutils.py

(cherry picked from commit 1c12bb80ec040fce33cc4d3f558177e873f0dbe1)

Change-Id: Ic8e6b40dcd9a14d5a3fc7f4ef0c5b23c89be599a

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Flavor Metadata Details

The metadata display widget was developed as a common way to
display additional metadata about images, volumes, and flavors
in the launch instance workflow. This fix integrates the metadata
widget into the source step for displaying the extra metadata.

It also corrects any additional styling problems in the widget itself.

The bug report includes detailed information on testing.

Closes-Bug: #1438505
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wroblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>
Change-Id: Id84548cfaaa50a3d1e299b34b3a2591ec02ed25b

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Source Details - Metadata

The metadata display widget was developed as a common way to
display additional metadata about images, volumes, and flavors
in the launch instance workflow. This fix integrates the metadata
widget into the source step for displaying the extra metadata.

It also corrects any additional styling problems in the widget itself.

The bug report includes detailed information on testing.

Closes-Bug: 1433792
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wroblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>
Change-Id: I547ccd6ccd65116fc8ac2e77d438bbf8c37a7afd

subject: Drop sql.transaction() usage in migration
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 16:12:13.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/federation/migrate_repo/versions/007_add_remote_id_table.py'], 'message': 'Drop sql.transaction() usage in migration

sql.transaction() creates a new Session() object, using config options,
so this new session do not related with `migrate_engine` engine, (even
can be connected to the different database).

Use sql.select() to select required data, instead of sql.transaction()

Change-Id: I64322efa21bca3a8395ab0f88024eb58c54b6090
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop sql.transaction() usage in migration

sql.transaction() creates a new Session() object, using config options,
so this new session do not related with `migrate_engine` engine, (even
can be connected to the different database).

Use sql.select() to select required data, instead of sql.transaction()

Change-Id: I64322efa21bca3a8395ab0f88024eb58c54b6090

commit_message:
Add tests for docker container

This patch add tests for container
start/stop/pause/reboot
unpause/delete/create/show

Also add ContainerException, as pep8 not allow Exception check
which it thinks too board.

Partial-Bug: #1439129

Change-Id: I3baeb2c91a7c49cc1871912a58fef23bebf68822

commit_message:
Improve logging for nagios_wrapper failures

Errors in runs will now be logged as errors rather than info.
Also fixes issue where the plugin would fail to unpackage status and msg
   on return

Change-Id: I9e44842361de855bfeed352c0193b8767944fbef

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-19 00:40:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix is_hostname_safe for RFC compliance

In the move from Node name supporting just a hostname to now
supporting a FQDN, we missed a few changes to keep this function
being RFC compliant.  This patch enhances the code and tests for
this, and migrates the database to the longer name field format.

Change-Id: Ib75c8b138d7165aedc74efead80d3fb755cab87b
Closes-Bug: #1433832

commit_message:
Fix is_hostname_safe for RFC compliance

In the move from Node name supporting just a hostname to now
supporting a FQDN, we missed a few changes to keep this function
being RFC compliant.  This patch enhances the code and tests for
this, and migrates the database to the longer name field format.

Change-Id: Ib75c8b138d7165aedc74efead80d3fb755cab87b
Closes-Bug: #1433832

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Glance rest API fix

Adds support for resource_type, so retrieved namespaces will have
properties with proper prefixes.

Closes-Bug: 1439312
Change-Id: I4c2b450db8189c99624290a1d678fcaf509e1de6

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Add Keypair Step Unit Tests

This patch adds unit tests for the keypair step.  These tests are focused
around the controller and its related components (no selenium tests or view
tests).

commit_message:
Shim extension for mac update allowed

Add a shim extension to flag that a port's mac address can be updated.
See mac_addr_update.rst spec in kilo for details on api change.

ApiImpact
Closes-Bug #1439335

Change-Id: I24f6e23dba79641a280ac67d59420829604dfb65

commit_message:
Remove QueueController from data to control plane

To separate data and control plane of storage layer;
Moving queue_controller from data to controll plane.
Trying to shift the QueueController object in Control plane.
For this new MessageQueueHandler class is also added inside storage/x/messages.py
And the newly added handler is added to the entry point.

Implements: blueprint split-data-and-control-plane
Co-Author: Flavio Percoco<flavio@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I8a167d6ed8e54c98b077b9ea56e68b4e8d5b0291

commit_message:
New field 'name' not supported in port REST API

Add support for referring to nodes by their logical name in the
port section of the REST API.

As part of this, refactored some code out of node.py into
utils.py, along with moving the corresponding tests.

Change-Id: I5dd61582e6e009f44dd3eed2ce014d0000c94b19
Closes-Bug: #1431204

commit_message:
Add hzSelect directive to Angular table

This patch adds a hzSelect directive to Angular table. The
directive should be set as an attribute on each row's select
checkbox. If `hzSelectAll` is defined, if all checkboxes in
the table is selected, the select all checkbox will be
selected.

Change-Id: Id1db39e617c7bcd57ef8a33f3f9c8ca71950491a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-29 16:10:13.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/section_keystone-concepts-user-management.xml', 'doc/admin-guide-cloud/ch_identity_mgmt.xml', 'doc/common/section_keystone-concepts-domain-management.xml'], 'message': 'Domains with users and projects

Administrators need to know about domains along with users and
projects, so move the description of domains into the "User
management" section where users and projects are defined.
Considering how short the domains section was it fits in.

Not mentioning domains along with users and projects leads to

Change-Id: I8117677a3bbf96f1caa6f17017e077391ec64457
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Domains with users and projects

Administrators need to know about domains along with users and
projects, so move the description of domains into the "User
management" section where users and projects are defined.
Considering how short the domains section was it fits in.

Not mentioning domains along with users and projects leads to
confusion.

Change-Id: I8117677a3bbf96f1caa6f17017e077391ec64457

used tenant, where the term to use is now project.

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Tenant to project in Identity concepts

The "Identity concepts" section in the Cloud Administrator Guide
used tenant, where the term to use is now project.

Change-Id: Id19067ebb6daa21ab63e10c4efecadaf1195912d

commit_message:
Fix UnicodeEncodeError issue when the language is not en_US

Add __str__() method into IronicException base class, and encode to utf-8
to make sure the wsme api can consume/format it as well.

Change-Id: I183bbb78d738992ec91dff1ebed698cf84aa06ca
Closes-Bug: 1437170

commit_message:
Add display-name option to example apache2 configuration

Without this option impossible to find ironic API wsgi process in
system process list, it displayed as 'apache2'. With this option
'(wsgi:ironic)' process displayed.

Change-Id: If391d898b063f02a44050e2c95ee40d9a07b6b05

commit_message:
Add 7 missed meters in Resource Usage Panel.

We have made the ipmi meters visible in "Resource Usage" panel.
Now a meter should be removed and other 7 meters missed need to
be added in. All these meters are under IPMI protocol.

Change-Id: I34ed7187347ff4a4cfac7c572f16e03f1fe15b39
Closes-Bug: #1436635

Edits to the RabbitMQ durable queues sample config

The active/active AMQP doc says "Use durable queues in RabbitMQ"

Changed to "rabbit_durable_queues=true".

subject: cDOT driver should split clone from snapshot after creation
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-31 15:11:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'cDOT driver should split clone from snapshot after creation

When the cDOT driver receives a create_share_from_snapshot command,
it clones the share/flexvol from the specified snapshot in the
parent share/flexvol.  But if the resulting clone is not split
from its parent, the snapshot remains busy and may not be deleted.
This is resolved by starting a clone split operation anytime a
clone is created.

During the split operation, which usually completes within
seconds, the snapshot remains busy.  This patch detects that
condition in the snapshot delete path and waits up to a minute
for the busy condition to clear.

Change-Id: I44bac106f7f7a1acc968c1d9a526dcef85f657b7
Closes-Bug: #1259988

commit_message:
cDOT driver should split clone from snapshot after creation

When the cDOT driver receives a create_share_from_snapshot command,
it clones the share/flexvol from the specified snapshot in the
parent share/flexvol.  But if the resulting clone is not split
from its parent, the snapshot remains busy and may not be deleted.
This is resolved by starting a clone split operation anytime a
clone is created.

During the split operation, which usually completes within
seconds, the snapshot remains busy.  This patch detects that
condition in the snapshot delete path and waits up to a minute
for the busy condition to clear.

Change-Id: I44bac106f7f7a1acc968c1d9a526dcef85f657b7
Closes-Bug: #1259988

commit_message:
Add modularize-neutron-plays specification

This spec summarizes the requirement for modularizing
the neutron playbooks, and the proposed way to accomplish this.

Patch 3 has added details for master & juno modifications

Implements blueprint: modularize-neutron-plays

Signed-off-by: Javeria Khan <javeria.ak@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove repo settings if Ubuntu installer gets done

We have to keep system clear after installation, because otherwise we
may have some bad post effect. You see, the Nailgun itself sends task
for adding repos to the slaves so there could be some conflicts if
by some reason we had use different set of repos for provisioning and
deployment.

Change-Id: I43ee90bbeee096244ad4dd6c2e32b7663ae56904
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu

commit_message:
Remove api-paste.ini as it provided by package

Since we have no attribute overrides for api-paste.ini, no
need to have a template resource for it.  Until we need to
have some attribute, removing this will take away burden of
keeping in sync with base openstack code.

Change-Id: Ic72c638ba61929bc06061b04d13ce986514b0460
Related-Bug: #1433152

commit_message:
Raise an error when san private key is missing

Currently, if san private key is missing, cookbook will create an
empty one which cause cinder can't work properly.

This patch will check whether san private key is exist or not, if
not, raise an error to remind user to provide one.

Change-Id: Ia1e0a60dec9ef463a908756fffa5f5274ebc0fb7

commit_message:
Add mariadb database configuration support

1. Add 2 new recipes to configure mariadb client and server
2. Partially reuse existing code for mysql support
3. Add delete empty user and users with empty password workaround.
Current mysql cookbook can do this, but mariadb cookbook doesn't.

blueprint: mariadb-support
Change-Id: I034cedb07f8bf11f271fc351f9a7ad534067b95a
